result.execSummary:
The defendant Molly J Peacock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED - would be eligible for Challenge Inc & Substance Abuse program after 3 years 6 months incarceration.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Undergo Mental Health examination & comply with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with Mitch F, Randy F & Russel E.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

timeConds.notes: First 3 months on house arrest through JSS, then 6 months CJ w/credit for 59 days & then 2 more months on house arrest on EM.

Sentencing hearing on June 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

9:45 AM - Def in court w/Atty Peter Brian Kisken.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CRT: 2 issues - the plea and then the JSS capias that has been outstanding since  3/16
Amended Information filed
Ct. 1 - consipracy to deliver heroin - Guilty
SNP filed/signed/understands
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs in the last 24 hrs
  Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
Ltr from Mayo
Crt: At sentencing, I will consider the actions in the 2 uncharged incident numbers and the active capias and that factors into the court's view of whether or not community supervision is approp.  OTD dated  3/15 for failure to provide urine sample  or missed UA... KISKEN: we talked about this in depth and we feel that there is no excuse for her to have failed to appear in a timely manner and that the primary issue is she's severely addicted to H and in that regard she has brought a ltr outlining a plan from her doc recognizing the fact that she may go to jail today. CRT: she had been at LE Phillips and d/c to LAAR house. KISKEN: she didn't successfully complete LAAR house. CRT: in the report she was going to be living w/ her mom v. the rental unit and it's implied that it wasn't a good place. MARY BUSHEK: I understand she needs med assisted trmt to get thru her addiction. CRT: I understand the doc's reluctance to get someone started on the program as there is a w/drawal process when they go off. We have used med assisted trmt in the DC and it can be a real aid and I am not surprised to see that recommendation and frankly I would prefer if someone is going to be involved it be thru one of the hospitals. SULESKI: leave to the court. We have been here quite a few times b/f. KISKEN: her mom is also an RN.  
BOND: $2000.00 cash bond - (this is in addition to the $1000.00 already posted) 
COND: house arrest - out for employment or education to be enforced thru GPS and follow the trmt program outlined by Dr. Onsrud and sign releases for JSS to monitor compliance. I can't sit by and watch bond violations. If I impose probation I have to make sure you are a good candidate for community supervision and your conduct up to this point leaves me w/ a real question. Even if a person is addicted, they can still show up for trmt, testing and when someone doesn't that gives me a question if I can trust them to be successful on probation. If the bond is posted it's a 2 edge sword. 
SENTENCING: 7 weeks - need an hr - Andrea to set
PSI due one week before

JSS Detention - signed by Judge Horne

From: JSS 
SLH: noted
signed SLH
appeared in court

11:10 AM - Def in court w/Atty Peter Brian Kisken.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
KISKEN: she has plans to go to either LE Phillips or LAAR House if you don't send her to jail. She has this addiction problem and needs trmt. I have advised her to do her best to get into trmt. KELLIS: I am glad she got the ins and get trmt lined up and not trying to ask the court to punish her for being addictive but it's hard to sit back and watch repeated violations. I don't know if the court has the choice to impose forced sobriety if she can't stop herself from violating. I will leave it up the the court. MOM:  either LE Phillips today after court or LAAR house. Phillips is preferred since they have an active in pt detox. CRT:  the OTD is QUASHED. I will be very frank, I had every intention of reimposing the cash bond today and if it couldn't be posted you would remain in custody until it was. Bottom line is if you are doing your part then we will work w/ you but if you leave trmt, skip appts or not involved in group or what ever is recommended by the professionals
BOND MODIFIED: def is to be in either Mary or Mark Busheks custody from now until arrivess at LE Phillips today and she is to remain there until discharge. Atty Kisken is to set a BBH w/in 48 hrs of discharge
Your conduct on bond has an influence on sentencing. If you won't comply w/ the trmt recommendations then it's a stmt to me that if there's trmt it's best accomplished in an inst setting. Understand what's at stake

9:45 AM - Def in court w/Atty Peter Brian Kisken.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
KISKEN: she requests the NC be dropped. He's no longer being charged and they are no longer co- defs. She is going to attend LAAR house. Has a medical clearance tomorrow and there's an open bed. SKEMP: we object, he isn't not being charged, the potential that he would be a witness in this matter - he has a long hx of illegal behavior and during the pendency of this case contact isn't advised. It is a conspiracy case and test will be needed if it goes to trial. CRT: won't lift it today. We'll see the situation after she finishes LAAR house. Concerns of the state are well placed. Not ruling it out in the future but want to see what the situation is once you are clean.
